visualization_prompt: Generate an interactive areaspline chart showing weekly fruit consumption patterns using a time-controlled slider interface with synthetic data reflecting seasonal demand fluctuations
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two temporal series: daily consumption values (7 categorical points per week) and seasonal averages (continuous numerical values). Synthetic data follows agricultural patterns - weekly values (μ=1.8, σ=0.4 kg) show mid-week peaks, while seasonal averages demonstrate a polynomial growth trend (R²=0.96) reflecting harvest cycles. The areaspline format maximizes data-ink ratio through continuous fill encoding, while the dual-series design follows Cairo's principle of multivariable comparison. The red reference line (σ=0.5 kg) provides perceptual anchoring, with blue fill intensity encoding deviation from norm. Interactive controls maintain Tufte's layering principle by keeping secondary controls separate from primary data display.
